activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Case not called on record - waiting on lab results - rescheduled to November 15, 2022 3:00 PM

Calling 19CF279, 20CF143, 21CF35, 21CF243, 22CF44 & 21TR1795. Katte does not have offer from the State - waiting on lab results. Sowinski states lab results have not been received. records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marylyn V. Pierce in court.  Attorney Anne M. Katte appeared by video for Marylyn V. Pierce. Calling 19CF279, 20CT143, 21CF35, 21CF243,  22CF44 & 21TR1795. 22CF44 is set for an adjourned initial appearance. Katte in receipt of complaint, waive reading - would like to waive preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Katte willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski statement to blood test result time frame. Bond continued. adj. 01:45 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marylyn V. Pierce appeared in court. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Defendant states she is employed - states new address. Court sets bond - defendant to submit to booking. adj. 01:58 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
